mention.text: Richard Dowden is director of the Royal African Society and author of Africa
The views expressed in this commentary
The views expressed in this commentary
The abduction of more than 200 schoolgirls in northeast Nigeria
more than 200 schoolgirls in northeast Nigeria
the top item on all global news channels
this remote , dry , dusty corner of Nigeria
a place you would only visit on your way to the Sahara Desert
an attempt to clamp down but the security extended there never reached Maidugri
the kidnapping of more than 200 girls
unemployment , lack of education and health services
a fast-growing population in the northeast matter
a fundamentalist but not particularly violent movement in 2002
the Niger Delta which produces Nigeria 's immense oil wealth
Gangs of youths with heavy machine guns
no such incentive to develop Bornu state
The Kanuri people of northeast Nigeria need robust protection , peace and security in the short term but they
The biggest challenge facing Obama and the Americans
the failure of President Goodluck Jonathan to focus on the problems of northeast Nigeria
